Event.name: Trap
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Deceiver</fen> sets up a <fen>Trap</fen> in order to cause a <fen>Victim</fen> to have an incorrect understanding about a situation. The <fen>Deceiver</fen> anticipates that this will lead the <fen>Victim</fen> to take a course of action (including doing nothing) which causes the <fen>Victim</fen> harm.
<ex>Setting a <fex name="tra"><t>trap</t></fex> <fex name="vic">for your opponents</fex> is usually a good strategy.</ex>
<ex><fex name="tra">It</fex>'s a trap!</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Trap
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Trap</fen> is a device, strategy, or system designed to mislead and cause harm to a <fen>Victim</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Victim
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Deceiver</fen> intends to mislead and cause harm to the <fen>Victim</fen> by means of the <fen>Trap</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: trap.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a device or strategy to mislead and cause harm.

lexUnit.name: snare.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a means to deceive and entrap.
